item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 8, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Kill your Feeds – Stop letting algorithms dictate what you think (134 points | 56 comments)
2. AI tools are spotting errors in research papers: inside a growing movement (239 points | 103 comments)
3. Discovering Errors in Donald Knuth's Taocp (65 points | 13 comments)
4. You might not need Redis (65 points | 44 comments)
5. The program is the database is the interface (76 points | 23 comments)
6. Discworld Rules (111 points | 131 comments)
7. Kagi Is Bringing Orion Web Browser to Linux (42 points | 11 comments)
8. Spark-TTS: Text-2-Speech Model Single-Stream Decoupled Tokens [pdf] (16 points | discuss)
9. Long Read: Lessons from Building Semantic Search for GitHub and Why I Failed (66 points | 8 comments)
10. Spice Data (YC S19) Is Hiring a Founding Senior/Staff Software Engineer ( | hide)
11. Show HN: I built a tool to detect scams (12 points | 2 comments)
12. Google will still have to break up its business, the Justice Department said (22 points | 2 comments)
13. Ultrasonic deep drawing cuts friction by 20%, extends tool lifespan (51 points | 15 comments)
14. An epic treatise on error models for systems programming languages (172 points | 55 comments)
15. Feds arrest man for sharing DVD rip of Spider-Man movie with millions online (21 points | 27 comments)
16. Explore Sutro Tower (47 points | 17 comments)
17. Falkon: A KDE Web Browser (138 points | 67 comments)
18. Show HN: Open-Source DocumentAI with Ollama (244 points | 29 comments)
19. Undocumented backdoor found in Bluetooth chip used by a billion devices (205 points | 66 comments)
20. AI models makes precise copies of cuneiform characters (56 points | 16 comments)
21. Valentin Hansen: Creating an Infinite Sound (11 points | 4 comments)
22. "Wooly mice" a test run for mammoth gene editing (51 points | 42 comments)
23. Sam Bankman-Fried thrown into solitary over Tucker Carlson interview: report (96 points | 98 comments)
24. Forces deep underground seem to be deforming Earth's inner core (38 points | 17 comments)
25. Cat-Eared Robots Are Waiting Tables in Japan's Restaurants (28 points | 29 comments)
26. Introducing command And commandfor In HTML (393 points | 229 comments)
27. Mountains, Cliffs, and Caves: A Guide to Using Perlin Noise for Procedural Gen (150 points | 29 comments)
28. Ask HN: Do your eyes bug you even though your prescription is "correct"? (294 points | 283 comments)
29. Polars Cloud: The Distributed Cloud Architecture to Run Polars Anywhere (239 points | 84 comments)
30. Vtm: Text-Based Desktop Environment (282 points | 81 comments)
